text: the goal really is to say healthy long
enough to get to the point where we have
these future technologies we talk about
three bridges to radical life extension
bridge to is biotechnology reprogramming
the information underlying our biology
bridge 3 is nanotechnology going beyond
biology bridge 1 is what we can do right
now and a major part of that is
nutrition because what we take inside of
our bodies has a profound effect on our
health it's actually a pretty moderate
program that's not eat low carb or low
fat it's actually eat healthy carbs like
fruits and vegetables and avoid
unhealthy carbs like sugar and starches
eat healthy fats like omega-3 fats found
in fish or monounsaturated fat found and
nuts avoid unhealthy fats like saturated
fat found in meat we need to actually
augment our food with certain
supplements even medications there's one
medication which is an old diabetes drug
called metformin that actually appears
to have anti-aging benefits so there are
certain things that actually can make us
healthier that go beyond food and people
say well you take these supplements and
pills and you you think that's gonna
enable you to live hundreds of years no
the goal of what I'm doing now which we
call bridge 1 is just to get to bridge 2
which is only 10:15 at most 20 years
away which is the full maturation of the
biotechnology revolution where it can
really reprogram our biology away from
disease and away from aging and that
will be a bridge to bridge 3 which is a
nanotechnology revolution
sample nano robots in your bloodstream
that augment your immune system that can
destroy virtually all disease
